text: - Previously on The Resident... - A few weeks ago,
a wonderful man who loved me proposed.
I took so long to decide that he changed his mind.
- Wait, is this for us? - Yes, of course it's for us.
- We can get a hot tub. Raise chickens. - What?
I don't move in with you, so you just leave me.
If you're not interested in going forward, for me,
it's time to take a step back.
So my kidneys will never work again?
You have to stay on dialysis
- for the rest of your life, Jess. - Come on.
There's got to be another option.
It's not that you can't give Jessie your kidney,
Why can't you for once, for once,
do something that is not selfish?
Hey, this is Kyle. You know what to do.
♪ I could lie, say I like it like that ♪
♪ I could lie, say I like it like that ♪
♪ Don't you know too much already? ♪
I've been thinking a lot about us.
And I realized something, so just hear me out.
And I keep... trying to solve them all by myself.
completely incapable of asking for help.
I don't know why I do that.
- as a kid. - No, no, I don't...
I don't want to do that.
I don't want to make excuses.
I want to see the pattern,
You said you want to move forward
I just need you to meet me halfway.
- What do you mean? - It means...
I want to start talking about moving in,
marriage, a family, all of it.
Let me do this at my own pace.
I just only have one request.
Your company, Red Rock Mountain Medical,
is the top health care conglomerate in the Southeast.
But your family is missing a crucial piece.
We now own every major hospital within a hundred-mile radius.
You need to eliminate the competition.
Chastain is in no position to undercut our pricing.
We're a top facility. We're unmatched.
But our research shows the words most closely associated
with Chastain are "Dr. Lane Hunter" and "QuoVadis."
That's behind us. It's old news.
I view it as a success story.
We were instrumental in exposing corruption.
we will discuss internally and get back to you.
do avoid any further PR disasters.
A bit of news for you.
I'm putting a pacemaker in Micah today.
So, don't worry. You don't need to be there.
Because you're emotionally involved with the patient.
Well, that's hardly enough time to get over heartbreak.
Take it from the heartbreaker in chief.
All good. Let's pack up the patient and take him to ICU.
And, anyway, I'm not going to the Atlanta Gore Fest.
Oh, well, if you love your boo, you will.
I see enough gore all day long.
Jessica wouldn't want to hold hands
and scream with me in the dark.
And I have a previous commitment.
This place is my main squeeze these days.
- possible broken left arm, minor scrapes and bruises. Okay.
Let's start another large bore IV and hang another liter
- of normal saline. One, two, three. - One, two...
Can you tell us your name, please, sir?
Okay, let's add LFTs, coags, UTox,
aspirin/acetaminophen levels, and a blood alcohol level.
If not, have them call local shelters,
see if anyone's missing or fits the description, while we try
- to get his pain under control. - I'll order an X-ray
and get Dr. Voss to take a look at that arm.
Must be very rewarding to be a transplant coordinator.
We need more donors to step up.
Too many people die waiting for an organ.
That's my biggest fear with my sister.
How is she doing on dialysis?
Um, she's in early heart failure.
It's causing a lot of problems.
A new organ could help her heart.
Yeah. But we can't wait years to get one.
- Can I help you? - Yeah, maybe.
Would you like me to page her?
They had to abort dialysis because her pressure dropped.
Your sats are a little low.
Gonna do our best. This should help.
is to switch up your heart medication
All right, Nic and I need to discuss our options.
And I saw signs of hepatojugular reflux.
Her heart failure is getting worse,
Treatment of dual organ failure is challenging,
Heart failure alone could kill Jessie.
There are cases where that alone improves heart function.
She might not need a new heart for ten years.
Your father's still the most logical donor.
And now I can't find him. He's disappeared.
- I-I've called him over and over again. - Which is why
I asked my dad to try and track him down.
He put his private investigator on him,
and now I have an address.
He knows what we're saying, but he can't speak.
Maybe when he fell and broke his arm, he-he hit his head.
Still no kin we can find, no proxy to tell us who he is.
Squeeze my hand. Squeeze my hand.
We're up to the letter "S" now?
When we can't identify patients, we name them after flowers.
Bell's been tightening the screws down here.
He told me, and I quote,
Since when do we do anything
but try to work around Bell?
Given his age and how he was found,
he might have dementia. In which case, this...
We need to take care of this man.
- or whether or not he's insured. - Mm-hmm.
If there is an underlying diagnosis,
like a brain bleed or a tumor,
delay could cause irreparable damage, even death.
At the bare minimum, a CT is standard of care.
Let us know when we have the results.
So it's definitely a type 2 second-degree heart block.
aren't getting through to your heart.
How serious is the surgery to...
- implant a pacemaker? - Oh, it's no big deal, bruh.
Quick procedure. In an hour, you'll be a new man.
You seem to be in good spirits.
Yeah, and I have never been better.
Seriously, on top of the world.
This is Dr. Austin. He's going to be putting in
Thank you for taking such good care of my Micah.
- Hey, I've been looking for you. - What are you doing here?
I'll meet you in the parking lot in an hour.
Terrible choice in men, working on that.
I've been trying to reach you.
I didn't want to be reached.
ended badly and I'm sorry if... you've been upset.
But you're not sorry for what you said.
Look, can we just... can we go inside?
- Can we talk? - No, I just...
It's a little early for me.
I've got a... a long drive back, so...
You know what this is about, Kyle.
and she's determined to stay that way.
It's not just her kidneys anymore.
Wait, what... what does that mean,
- her heart is failing? - We're trying to stabilize it
so she's still eligible for a kidney,
but the truth is, she has a very...
I know you wanted her to be sober six months
to make sure she doesn't relapse,
but she doesn't have six months.
But what I do know is that...
right now you're the only person who could save her.
I still drink more than I should.
I can't believe that my kidney is her best option.
Strange I ended up by a lake.
Is it so wrong of me?
is pretty low... for the donor.
Next time I see you will be at Jessie's funeral.
And it'll be the last time that I see you.
He does have a ruptured aneurysm.
But it's small, right there in your Broca's area.
Which could explain why he can't speak.
Or all his symptoms are caused by dementia,
so we'll ask for a neuro consult.
What if they say he needs surgery?
Which means the hospital decides all his care,
Let's be conservative a little while longer.
Take him to the ER for observation.
then we have a stronger case to make to Bell,
one that will be harder for him to refuse.
But now I'm here with you.
All my wishes are spelled out.
The hospital has a copy, too.
We're in a bad spot, aren't we?
I know you'll find a way to blame yourself.
You went to see Dad, didn't you?
I went to let him know where we stand.
I was hoping he'd step up.
How is this not infuriating to you?
But if we lose the battle...
there's just one more thing I'll ask, okay?
And let him know that I forgive him, too.
Is that the surgery you and Dr. Austin
- I have a request. - Same here.
I wish this corned beef was more tender.
Shira is the anesthesiologist on Micah's surgery.
I need you to take her off the case.
I... Something's up with that girl. I do not trust her.
And you want what's best for Micah.
Okay. Deal. I'll get Paul Chu on it.
You still planning on scrubbing in?
And he says he is happier than he has ever been.
I did not enjoy delivering that ten-blade to your heart.
But I had to see if you still had feelings for your ex-fiancé,
and by your reaction, you do.
So no, you will not be scrubbing in.
Anybody who'd replace you so quickly
All right. Thank you so much.
Jessie just gave me her advance directive.
I can't bring myself to read it.
Anybody need a kidney around here?
I've got some good news. Thanks to Dr. Hawkins,
your heart failure has improved for now.
We can move ahead with the transplant if we move fast.
First, we'll bring you to the OR.
Uh, as we're removing your kidney,
will prep your daughter in a separate OR.
When she's ready, we'll implant your kidney into Jessie.
Six to eight hours from now,
you should both wake up, ready to make a full recovery.
Six to eight hours from right now?
Well, you guys, um... you don't fool around, do you?
Dr. Voss, I need your help.
- We don't know his real name. - It's...
I have a patient like Sunflower
on every floor of this hospital.
This is exactly the kind of case that's bankrupting Chastain.
Sunflower has a brain bleed, and his symptoms are getting worse.
Well, it could be sundowning, nighttime confusion.
It's possible. But I don't think it's dementia.
Well, I... You can't be sure. This bleed is small.
Well, it could be the cause of all his symptoms.
It could be curable, Dr. Bell.
We had a neuro consult, and he recommended surgery.
Are you going to deny it?
He was found in Piedmont Park, wearing sweats.
If he was jogging, had a fall,
that could explain why he had no wallet or ID.
There is no police report, no missing persons file.
Yeah, he could be from out of town.
Even if he's homeless... what does it matter?
What about the health of this hospital?
Chastain is on the brink of a disaster.
I need to save it, too.
Just stay with him for five minutes.
See the human being and not the numbers this time.
What are you trying to say?
Wait. What's that... What is that for?
That's to start an IV, Dad.
My-my-my... my mouth is so dry.
Can you give us a second?
We have an excellent transplant team.
Brave is not my resting state.
You're gonna come out of this just fine.
And for the rest of your life, you are going to be happy
that you did this, I promise you.
I was leaving for the day and I saw this guy breaking into
a car. Says he's a friend of a doctor here,
but nobody has this amount of drugs
unless they're dealing or using or both.
I'll s... I'll see you in a few hours, okay?
Nic? Nic, there's something that I really need to tell you,
s-something I should have told you a long time ago.
You can tell me on the other side.
- No, no, sweetheart, this is important. - Dad.
I will be your anesthesiologist tonight.
the vessels and remove the kidney.
I'll meet you in the parking lot in an hour.
The recipient is open and ready to receive the donor kidney.
We lost his airway. IV's out.
Oh, my God, he cut an artery.
Call a code! Start bagging Shira!
He's crashing! Jump in. My hands are full.
Tubes and lines are all pulled.
His airway's full of blood. Suction!
He can't go much longer without oxygen.
It's too swollen. I can't get the tube in.
Sats are 60 and dropping. He's gonna code.
We need to do a cric. It's the only way.
Come on, come on, come on.
Come on, Dad. Come on, Dad.
Oxygen levels are still really low.
Bilateral breath sounds. Tube is in place.
Let's load her on a gurney and we'll take her to the ER.

Can we proceed with harvesting the kidney?
The risk is higher, but the bleed is stopped. Are you sure?
Because he's been through a lot. If we get him to the ICU,
he could fully recover before we move on.

- BP is holding. - Jessie's window for a kidney is closing.
Her best shot is now. I say we go on.
Come on, come on, come on.

Thank you for covering for me
while I was stuck in the other OR, Dr. Austin.
Looks good. Stand by to reperfuse the kidney.
They're about to see if Jessie's new kidney works.

- Clear. - Her heart is too weak.
V-fib. We need to get that rhythm under control now.
We're at max joules. Charge again.

Let's unclamp these vessels and, uh, try this again.
Ah. That is a beautiful thing.
The new kidney is working like a champ.

Devon told me you okayed the surgery
Yeah, well, it's gonna go in the red column for Chastain.
That column is already very long.
I should probably let you know
I'm... I'm back with my ex-husband.
But I care about you and I believe in you.
Nurture the man I see right here.
I still can't believe all this happened.
Take a break, get some air.
I promise I'll page you if anything changes.
Do you know where you are?
You're at Chastain Park Memorial Hospital.
And we've been taking care of you.
Can you tell us your name?
Well, it's nice to meet you.
Is there someone we can call for you, Mr. Wilson?
To let them know where you are?
Dr. Smook was not our fault.
I've learned the medical board of Pennsylvania pulled
her license for drug abuse, so she moved here.

You are fortunate that your original pitch

Well, I remain as CEO, that's nonnegotiable.

about the running of the hospital would shift

No, you don't. There's nothing left to consider, Dr. Bell.
